column1: 86-year-old man, suspected close contact of nCOV-19 positive patient. It occurs in pulmonary stenosis for dyspnea, fever and cough. Swab is performed, of which positivity is confirmed. Respiratory failure on blood gas analysis and rapid exitus before admission to Resuscitation.
“Frosted glass” type thickenings with bilateral subpleural distribution. Concomitant thickening of the interlobular septa (pattern crazy paving).
